sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词均含有"开始"之意。
means: begin ： 最常用词，含义广泛，其反义词是end，多用于行动、工作等的开始。
start ： 在许多场合可与begin通用，但start侧重动作的起点。
commence ： 可与begin换用，但commence系书面正式用词，语气庄重，特指有正式程序或一定仪式，或某种正式行动的"开始"。
initiate ： 指创始或发起，侧重某过程的第一步，不考虑结束，强调起始。
inaugurate ： 指正式而隆重的开始。

Sentence.come: 出自-2010年考研翻译原文

Sentence.sentence: In fat， circumstances seem to be designed to bring out the best in us and if we feel that we have been “wronged” then we are unlikely to begin a conscious effort to escape from our situation.
Sentence.come: 出自-2011年考研翻译原文

Sentence.sentence: This trend ,which we believe is still in its infancy, effectively began with retailers and travel providers such as airlines and hotels and will no doubt go further.
Sentence.come: 出自-2011年考研阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: As the first signs of recovery begin to take hold, deputy chiefs may be more willing to make the jump without a net.
Sentence.come: 出自-2011年考研阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: This is because the networked computer has sparked a secret war between downloading and uploading - between passive consumption and active creation - whose outcome will shape our collective future in ways we can only begin to imagine.
Sentence.come: 出自-2012年考研阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: As the cost to everyone else has become clearer, politicians have begun to clamp down.
Sentence.come: 出自-2012年考研阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: How does your reading proceed? Clearly you try to comprehend, in the sense of identifying meanings for individual words and working out relationships between them, drawing on your explicit knowledge of English grammar ( ' , 41) you begin to infer a context for the text, for insta4ce, by making decisions about what kind of speech event is involved: who is making the utterance, to whom, when and where.
Sentence.come: 出自-2015年考研阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: Since the beginning, this price tag has been PreCheck’s fatal flaw.
Sentence.come: 出自-2017年考研阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: The development of the Elizabethan drama for the next twenty-five years is of exceptional interest to students of literary history, for in this brief period we may trace the beginning, growth, blossoming, and decay of many kinds of plays, and of many great careers.
Sentence.come: 出自-2018年考研翻译原文

Sentence.sentence: A native literary drama had been created, its alliance with the public playhouses established, and at least some of its great traditions had been begun.
Sentence.come: 出自-2018年考研翻译原文

Sentence.sentence: We are still at the beginning of this revolution and small choices now may turn out to have gigantic consequences later.
Sentence.come: 出自-2018年考研阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: To the horror of some who expected a Greek Revival twin of the Treasury Building to be erected on the other side of the White House, the elaborate French Second Empire style design by Alfred Mullett was selected, and construction of a building to house all three departments began in June of 1871.
Sentence.come: 出自-2018年考研阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: The history of the EEOB began long before its foundations were laid.
Sentence.come: 出自-2018年考研阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: "If we were really bold, we might even begin to think of high-calorie fast food in the same way as cigarettes—by setting strict limits on advertising, product placement and sponsorship of sport events," he said.
Sentence.come: 2011年考研真题（英语二）阅读理解 Section Ⅱ

Sentence.sentence: Earlier this year the country's Defense Advanced Research Projects Agency announced plans to pay Boeing to investigate formation flighty though the programme has yet to begin.
Sentence.come: 2010年考研真题（英语二）阅读理解 Section Ⅱ

Sentence.sentence: It was argued at the end of the 19th century that humans do not cry because they are sad but they become sad when the tears begin to flow.
Sentence.come: 2011年考研真题（英语一）完形填空 Section Ⅰ

Sentence.sentence: We might then begin to solve our immigration challenges.
Sentence.come: 2013年考研真题（英语二）阅读理解 Section Ⅱ

Sentence.sentence: You begin to infer a context for the text, for instance, by making decisions about what kind of speech event is involved: who is making the utterance, to whom, when and where.
Sentence.come: 2015年考研真题（英语一）阅读理解 Section Ⅱ

sentences.en: Let's begin.
sentences.cn: 我们开始吧！

sentences.en: Are you sitting comfortably?Then I'll begin.
sentences.cn: 坐好了吗?那我要开始了。

sentences.en: When does the film begin?
sentences.cn: 电影什么时候开始?

sentences.en: When will the next term begin?
sentences.cn: 下学期什么时候开学?

sentences.en: The campaign had begun during his absence.
sentences.cn: 在他不在期间运动已经开始了。

sentences.en: Knowledge begins with practice.
sentences.cn: 知识始于实践。

sentences.en: He begins school today.
sentences.cn: 他今天开始上学。

sentences.en: We decided to begin the experiment in the evening.
sentences.cn: 我们决定晚上开始那个实验。

sentences.en: It's time to begin the meeting now.
sentences.cn: 现在是开会的时候了。

sentences.en: He began to learn Japanese three years ago.
sentences.cn: 3年前他开始学日语。

sentences.en: He began to laugh.
sentences.cn: 他笑起来了。

sentences.en: The child began to cry.
sentences.cn: 孩子哭了起来。

sentences.en: Computers have also begun serving agriculture.
sentences.cn: 计算机也开始为农业服务了。

sentences.en: My heart suddenly began beating violently.
sentences.cn: 我的心突然开始猛烈地跳动。

data.mean: to begin with 起初；开始

sentence.cn: 因此，即使今天排放量开始减少，我们仍将面临适应气候变化的挑战。
sentence.en: So even if emissions were to begin to decrease today,  we would still face the challenge of adapting to climate change.
sentence.from: 2017年高考英语江苏卷 阅读理解 阅读D 原文

sentence.cn: 一切都从报名参加一个组织开始。
sentence.en: It all begins here,  by signing up to join an organization.
sentence.from: 2016年高考英语浙江卷（6月） 阅读理解 七选五 原文

entry.def: To begin to do something means to start doing it.

example.ex: He stood up and began to move around the room...
example.tran: 他起身开始在屋里来回走动。

example.ex: The weight loss began to look more serious...
example.tran: 体重下降眼看开始变得愈发厉害了。

entry.def: When something begins or when you begin it, it takes place from a particular time onwards.

example.tran: 问题在去年11月份开始出现。

example.ex: He has just begun his fourth year in hiding...
example.tran: 他东躲西藏的第四个年头刚刚开始。

entry.def: If you begin with something, or begin by doing something, this is the first thing you do.
entry.tran: 从…开始；从…着手；首先做（某事）

example.ex: Could I begin with a few formalities?
example.tran: 请允许我开场先讲几句套话。

example.ex: ...a businessman who began by selling golf shirts from the boot of his car...
example.tran: 靠他的汽车后备箱练摊兜售高尔夫球衫起家的商人

entry.def: You use begin to mention the first thing that someone says.

example.ex: 'Professor Theron,' he began, 'I'm very pleased to see you'...
example.tran: “西伦教授，”他开口说道，“很高兴见到您。”

example.ex: He didn't know how to begin.

entry.def: If one thing began as another, it first existed in the form of the second thing.

example.ex: What began as a local festival has blossomed into an international event.
example.tran: 原先的地方节日已经发展成为一项国际性活动。

entry.def: If you say that a thing or place begins somewhere, you are talking about one of its limits or edges.

example.ex: The fate line begins close to the wrist...
example.tran: 命运线始于接近手腕的地方。

example.ex: Rue Guynemer begins at the front of the Fitzgerald site.
example.tran: 吉内梅街始于菲茨拉德故居前。

entry.def: If a word begins with a particular letter, that is the first letter of that word.

example.ex: The first word begins with an F.

entry.def: If you say that you cannot begin to imagine, understand, or explain something, you are emphasizing that it is almost impossible to explain, understand, or imagine.
entry.tran: 无法，难以（解释、理解、想象等）

example.ex: You can't begin to imagine how much that saddens me.
example.tran: 你都无从想象这让我有多悲伤。

entry.def: You use to begin with when you are talking about the first stage of a situation, event, or process.

example.ex: It was great to begin with but now it's difficult.
example.tran: 一开始非常好，但现在可就难了。

entry.def: You use to begin with to introduce the first of several things that you want to say.

example.ex: 'What do scientists you've spoken with think about that?' — 'Well, to begin with, they doubt it's going to work.'
example.tran: “跟你聊过的科学家是怎么看的？”——“嗯，首先，他们怀疑这能否行得通。”

means.word_mean: 1. take the first step or steps in carrying out an action;

sentences.sentence: "We began working at dawn"
"Who will start?"
"Get working as soon as the sun rises!"
"The first tourists began to arrive in Cambodia"
"He began early in the day"
"Let's get down to work now"

means.word_mean: 2. have a beginning, in a temporal, spatial, or evaluative sense;

sentences.sentence: "The DMZ begins right over the hill"
"The second movement begins after the Allegro"
"Prices for these homes start at $250,000"

means.word_mean: 3. set in motion, cause to start;

sentences.sentence: "The U.S. started a war in the Middle East"
"The Iraqis began hostilities"
"begin a new chapter in your life"
"Now listen, friends," he began

means.word_mean: 5. be the first item or point, constitute the beginning or start, come first in a series;

sentences.sentence: "The number 'one' begins the sequence"
"A terrible murder begins the novel"
"The convocation ceremoney officially begins the semester"

means.word_mean: 6. have a beginning, of a temporal event;

sentences.sentence: "WWII began in 1939 when Hitler marched into Poland"
"The company's Asia tour begins next month"

means.word_mean: 7. have a beginning characterized in some specified way;

sentences.sentence: "The novel begins with a murder"
"My property begins with the three maple trees"
"Her day begins with a work-out"
"The semester begins with a convocation ceremony"

means.word_mean: 8. begin an event that is implied and limited by the nature or inherent function of the direct object;

sentences.sentence: "begin a cigar"
"She started the soup while it was still hot"
"We started physics in 10th grade"

means.word_mean: 9. achieve or accomplish in the least degree, usually used in the negative;

sentences.sentence: "This economic measure doesn't even begin to deal with the problem of inflation"
"You cannot even begin to understand the problem we had to deal with during the war"

means.word_mean: 10. begin to speak, understand, read, and write a language;

sentences.sentence: "She began Russian at an early age"
"We started French in fourth grade"

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English  beginnan, of Germanic origin; related to Dutch and German beginnen

sentences.cn: 她哭起来了。
sentences.en: She began to cry.

sentences.cn: 开始下雪了。
sentences.en: It was beginning to snow.

sentences.cn: 我开始以为你是不会来了。
sentences.en: I was beginning to think you'd never come.

sentences.cn: 大家同时开始讲话。
sentences.en: Everyone began talking at once.

sentences.cn: 你们何时开始招募人员？
sentences.en: When will you begin recruiting?

sentences.cn: 音乐会什么时间开始？
sentences.en: When does the concert begin?

sentences.cn: 我开始感到头晕目眩。

sentences.cn: 客人们终于陆续到达了。
sentences.en: At last the guests began to arrive.

sentences.cn: 她首先对我们大家的到来表示感谢。
sentences.en: She began by thanking us all for coming.

sentences.cn: 我们于五月份启动了这项工程。
sentences.en: We began work on the project in May.

sentences.cn: 我上月就开始读这本小说，到现在还没读完。
sentences.en: I began (= started reading) this novel last month and I still haven't finished it.

sentences.cn: 他讲课前总是先让学生做预备练习题。

sentences.cn: 在经济复苏的迹象开始显现时，副总们或许更愿意在毫无保障的情况下离职。
sentences.en: As the first signs of recovery begin to take hold, deputy chiefs may be more willing to make the jump without a net.

sentences.cn: 你开始为文本推理出一个语境，比如，确定涉及何种言语事件：说者是谁，在对谁说，什么时间，什么地点。
sentences.en: You begin to infer a context for the text, for instance, by making decisions about what kind of speech event is involved: who is making the utterance, to whom, when and where.

sentences.cn: 今年早些时候国防高级研究计划局宣布了一系列计划:将调拨资金以供波音公司研究编队飞行,尽管这一项目还未开始。
sentences.en: Earlier this year the country's Defense Advanced Research Projects Agency announced plans to pay Boeing to investigate formation flighty though the programme has yet to begin.

sentences.cn: 但是她说道除非各个国家开始关注婴儿生命的关键的头一千天，否则它们在消除饥饿和贫困方面不会取得成效。
sentences.en: But?she says nations will not make progress fighting hunger and poverty until they begin to focus on those critical first thousand days.
sentences.from: 15年12月六级真题（第一套）| 听力

sentences.cn: to  disintegrate.当政府失去对权力的控制时，法律和秩序就会开始瓦解
sentences.en: When governments lose their control on power, law and order begin
sentences.from: 16年6月四级真题（第一套）| 阅读

sentences.cn: 人们常常认为脑力功能衰退是上了年纪的问题，但是一项新研究表明，脑功能的某些方面实际上在成年早期就开始衰退了。
sentences.en: Declining mental function is often seen as a problem of old age, but certain aspects of brain function actually begin their decline in young adulthood, a new study suggests
sentences.from: 16年6月四级真题（第一套）| 阅读

sentences.cn: 之后，我们才有可能着手解决在移民方面面临的挑战。
sentences.en: We might then begin to solve our immigration challenges.

sentences.cn: 这次会议后, 就要着手调整军师级干部.
sentences.en: After this meeting, we will begin reassignment of cadres at the army and divisional levels.

sentences.cn: 开始某项活动就是着手某件事情.
sentences.en: To begin some activity is to set about doing it.

sentences.cn: 据报道, 奥巴马上任后将立即着手推行“新政”,兑现竞选诺言.
sentences.en: According to reports, Obama will immediately begin implementation of his New Deal to honor election promises.

sentences.cn: 质量保证方面的应用可以从说明书、产品规范 、 法规和标准的联机检索着手.
sentences.en: Quality assurance applications can begin with the online retrieval of specifications, codes, and standards.

sentences.cn: 一次,在1854年伦敦再次爆发霍乱的时候, 约翰.斯诺着手准备对此进行调研.
sentences.en: So when another outbreak hit London in 1854, he was ready to begin his _____.

sentences.cn: 如何着手远比在何处结束来得困难.
sentences.en: How to begin is more difficult than where to stop.

sentences.cn: 我不知道该从哪里着手.
sentences.en: I do not know where to begin.

sentences.cn: 首先, 我们可以从减少食物供应量上着手,这样就可以吃的较少.
sentences.en: First, we could begin by serving less food in order to eat less.

sentences.cn: 我们认为, 解决煤炭运输紧张问题可以从多方面着手.
sentences.en: We think, solve coal to carry nervous problem to able to begin from many sided.

sentences.cn: 从一个固定的频率和振幅的噪音着手进行.
sentences.en: Begin with noise at one fixed frequency and amplitude.

sentences.cn: 我们来着手看看这项工程总的计划 吧.
sentences.en: Let's begin to look at the general plan of this project.

sentences.cn: 我不知道该从哪里着手数起.
sentences.en: I do not know where to begin counting them.

sentences.cn: 市场经济秩序的规制, 应首先从政府着手.
sentences.en: The compasses of market economy order is made, answer to begin the government above all.

sentences.cn: 假如要把任务完成得漂漂亮亮, 你必须着手组建一个卓越的团队.
sentences.en: If want to finish the job beautifully, you must begin to establish a predominant group.

sentences.cn: 以某种讨吉利的仪式着手做(某事)
sentences.en: To begin or inaugurate with a ceremony intended to bring good luck.

sentences.cn: 然后你就着手解决你正回避的任何事.
sentences.en: Then begin to attack whatever it is you're avoiding.

sentences.cn: 一开始, 每个人手牵着手围绕在大圈中央.
sentences.en: To begin, everyone gathers round the central focal point in a circle and holds hands.

sentences.cn: 解决这些问题从何着手呢?
sentences.en: Where shall we begin?

sentences.cn: 我想,要从科学和教育着手.
sentences.en: I believe we have to begin by tackling science and education.

sentences.cn: 由此,我们就可着手重建资本主义的道德基石.
sentences.en: In these ways we can begin to reattach capitalism to its moral moorings.

sentences.cn: 他们买了豪华的办公室和最先进的电脑, 但却不知该从何着手.
sentences.en: They have bought swanky offices and swanky computers, but have no idea where to begin.

sentences.cn: 但我从哪里着手 呢 ?
sentences.en: But where do I begin?

sentences.cn: 昨天我已经下令在三角洲着手成立这支部队.
sentences.en: I gave orders yesterday for it to begin to form, back in the Delta.

sentences.cn: 我该如何着手去查询?
sentences.en: How should I begin to inquire?

sentences.cn: 要想赢得女儿的欢心, 必须先从她母亲着手.
sentences.en: He that would the daughter win, must with the mother first begin.

sentences.cn: 即使没有实现完全的控制，罗马人的势力也足以让他们开始着手巩固政权了。
sentences.en: Even if not total, the Romans' hold was sufficient for them to begin the task of consolidation.

sentences.cn: 恐怕我有点糊涂了，我不确定该从何处着手。
sentences.en: I'm afraid I'm a little muddled. I'm not exactly sure where to begin.

sentences.cn: 难道我要在这些墙壁里寻找新的朋友和创始伟大的事业 吗 ?
sentences.en: Was it within these walls that I was to seek new friends and begin great fortunes?

sentences.cn: 求救结果文件中没有发现增量标记起始行错误!
sentences.en: Post error : No begin of increment marker found during scan!

sentences.cn: 放在最初的解释模块后面,script的起始部分.
sentences.en: At the begin of the script directly after the initial block of comment.
